revised_title: Preliminary Investigation of Boghead Coal Distillation Products at Low Temperatures
tldr: The author investigates the products of distilling boghead coal at low temperatures and discovers a colorless, mobile fluid resembling the odor of hawthorn blossoms. The fluid is analyzed and found to be butyl (valyl of Kolbe), a hydrocarbon radical. The author plans to isolate at least four more hydrocarbon radicals from the coal distillate.
